item.title: Why does my 'false' not work?
item.dc:creator: @ownage-2007 ownage-2007
item.description:
@ownage-2007 wrote:

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4718 == true) { npcId = 2026; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4718 == true) { isNpc = false; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Maybe but im probs wrong. I did add something like this but can’t remember what i did ill try and find out

Read full topic

item.title: Why does my 'false' not work?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Okay, this is SUPPOSED to turn you into Dharok when your wearing a Dharok Axe and turn you back to normal when you take it off. When I did not have this ‘false’ part, it worked and turned me into Dharok, but when I added the ‘false’ it didn’t do anything when I put on Dharok’s Axe. It’s like the false part totally cancelled out the ‘true’ part. My Server base is PimpScape if it matters. This is the code I’m using, is there anything wrong with it? : if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4718 == true) { npcId = 2026; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4718 == false) { isNpc = false; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Read full topic
